data.text:
Polycom SpectraLink 8020 and 8030 Wireless Telephones

A lightweight, rugged design and extensive feature support make the SpectraLink 8020 and 8030 Wireless Telephones the ideal, on-premises voice communication tool for office staff who need mobility within your building.

A lightweight, rugged design and extensive feature support make the Polycom SpectraLink 8020 and 8030 Wireless Telephones the ideal, on-premises voice communication tool for office staff.

The Polycom SpectraLink 8030 Wireless Telephone extends these capabilities by allowing instantaneous communication between employees independent of the PBX system, eliminating the need for two-way radios. In addition, the larger earpiece seals out background noise and provides comfort for frequent or lengthy calls.

Features and Benefits (SpectraLink 8020 and 8030 Wireless Telephones)

Slim, lightweight design with large, graphics-capable display

Lithium-ion battery packs for up to eight hours talk time and 160 hours standby

IP 53 standard, for dust protection and resistance to spraying water

MIL STD 810F for shock resistance

Office-quality speakerphone for hands-free operation

Navigation and soft keys for simple access to frequently used operations

Backlit keypad for low-light usage

Three VoWLAN QoS Options: SpectraLink Voice Priority (SVP), Wi-Fi Standard, Cisco Compatible Extensions (CCX) v4

Enterprise-grade, voice-optimized security

802.11a/b/g radio

MitelÂ® 3300 Controller SIP-certified interoperability

Mitel SX-50, Mitel SX-200, Mitel SX-2000, Mitel 3300 Controller digital interoperability with Telephony Gateway

Learn More
